content.description:
This is the easiest of the warmups and is worth doing.  Pad the rock, and cast off on good laybacks on the right-angling seam until hitting the juggy topout -- essentially shared with the topout of

Pinchy Warmup

.
content.location:
This is located on the warmup boulder, just left of

Pinchy Warmup

, and just right of

Sherman Pinch Problem

.

content.description: Sit start and stem your way up the dihedral using thin edges and precise footwork.  Top out straight for full value as bailing out to the right cuts down on your street cred.
content.location:
This is an obvious dihedral located in between

Syringe

and

Ode to Failure

.  It is probably the most striking line in the area.

content.description: This has a nice couple of moves.  Stand and pop to a cool right hand pinch before heading up to the jugs.
content.location:
It is just left of

Warmup Layback

and a couple of yards right of

Clutch

.

content.description: Pinchy Warmup follows sidepulls/crimps to a big move at the lip that gains an obvious square jug and a fun topout. This route makes for an excellent warmup problem and the classy sit-start bumps the grade up at least another number.
content.location: This is on the Warm-Up Boulder's right Side.

content.description: This is the best warm-up problem on the Warm-Up Boulder. Sit-start on match sidepull and make fun moves up the arete. Topout on the slab to the right.
content.protection: A pad if you so desire.
content.location: This is on the Warm-Up Boulder.  It is the right side arete.

content.description:
Sit start on the big rail, and make a few moves up the most polished, sloping crimps at Arthur's Rock. This is more fun than it looks but just barely....

Originally graded V8, the consensus seems to now be V9.
content.location: It is the leftmost line on the Warm-Up Boulder.

content.description:
I am keeping the grade on this one at V5, so everyone can see what a baller Hank Jones must have been, though it feels at least a full grade harder than

The Syringe

.... I recall trying this the day I climbed

The Vice

and not being able to figure it out!

Start on two high edges, and make a big move out right to the infamous pinch, then cross your left hand over to whatever you can make work.
content.location:
It is between

Le Crimp

and

Clutch

.

content.description: This is a really fun problem that proved to be a lot more deceiving than I thought at first.  Sit start with a left hand pinch and your choice of right handholds.  Finagle your way up to two jugs beneath the roof, and do a big move around the roof and top it out.
content.protection: Two pads would probably do it.
content.location: This problem is the second to the left one on the first obvious huge boulder you come to (a bit past the problem "Godzilla").  There are a couple of warmups to the right.
